shorts.title: Senior Care Expert Peter Tomasi of Scranton Explains How to Know When It’s Time for Home Care for HelloNation

shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: BREAKING: Pa. Health Department OKs Tenor Health acquisition application for 3 NEPA hospitals
shorts.description: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.
shorts.content: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.
shorts.content_distilled: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.

shorts.title: Tenor Health says NEPA hospital purchase deal remains under Pa. Department of Health review
shorts.title_distilled: Tenor Health says NEPA hospital purchase deal remains under Pa.
shorts.description: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.

shorts.title: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud
shorts.title_distilled: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud.
shorts.description: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.

shorts.title: HS SWIMMING: Galko leads Scranton Prep past Abington Heights in battle of unbeaten teams
shorts.title_distilled: HS SWIMMING: Galko leads Scranton Prep past Abington Heights in battle of unbeaten teams.
shorts.description: Sophia Galko won two individual events and was a member of a winning relay to lead Scranton Prep to an 86-80 win over Abington Heights on Thursday night at the University of Scranton in a Lackawanna League girls’ swimming meet in a battle of teams that entered the meet with undefeated records. Galko won the 100-yard butterfly and the 100 backstroke, and teamed with Eva Kaszuba, Ella Schofield, and Anna Millett to win the 200 medley relay for the Classics (7-0). The meet featured several exciting finishes with both teams having All-Region swimmers. Galko edged Abington Heights senior Gianna Vachino […]
shorts.content: Sophia Galko won two individual events and was a member of a winning relay to lead Scranton Prep to an 86-80 win over Abington Heights on Thursday night at the University of Scranton in a Lackawanna League girls’ swimming meet in a battle of teams that entered the meet with undefeated records. Galko won the 100-yard butterfly and the 100 backstroke, and teamed with Eva Kaszuba, Ella Schofield, and Anna Millett to win the 200 medley relay for the Classics (7-0). The meet featured several exciting finishes with both teams having All-Region swimmers. Galko edged Abington Heights senior Gianna Vachino […]
shorts.content_distilled: Sophia Galko won two individual events and was a member of a winning relay to lead Scranton Prep to an 86-80 win over Abington Heights on Thursday night at the University of Scranton in a Lackawanna League girls’ swimming meet in a battle of teams that entered the meet with undefeated records.

shorts.title: Johnson College hosts annual scholarship breakfast
shorts.title_distilled: Johnson College hosts annual scholarship breakfast.
shorts.description: Alyssa Nicholas, a Johnson College veterinary nursing program student, spoke at the college’s annual scholarship breakfast at Fiorelli Family Catering. During the event, 74 scholarships to the Scranton school were awarded from various community and industry partners.
shorts.content: Alyssa Nicholas, a Johnson College veterinary nursing program student, spoke at the college’s annual scholarship breakfast at Fiorelli Family Catering. During the event, 74 scholarships to the Scranton school were awarded from various community and industry partners.

shorts.title: Lackawanna County Court Notes, January 30, 2026
shorts.description: MARRIAGE LICENSE Isabella Shandra Jensen and Justin Thomas Preambo, both of Scranton PROPERTY TRANSACTIONS Daniel and Stephani Lanton, Scranton, to Jean Marie Kucharski, Scranton; a property at 215 Lake Scranton Road, Scranton, for $360,000. Shorena Tetrauli to Mamuka Sibashivili; a property at 78 Sheffick Drive, Clifton Twp., for $330,000. DIVORCES SOUGHT AnnMarie Gunshannon, Dupont, v. Michelle Gunshannon, Jefferson Twp.; married May 29, 2023, in Jefferson Twp.; pro se. Atiba Guerra, Pittston, v. Robyn Guerra, Scranton; married Oct. 2, 2015, in Lackawanna County; pro se. Joseph Applegate, Throop, v. Elda Applegate, Throop; married Sept. 17, 2019, in Niagara Falls, N.Y.; pro se. […]

shorts.title: Clipboard, January 30, 2026
shorts.description: Lackawanna County Bus trip: AARP NEPA Chapter 3731 will host a bus trip to the premiere showing of “Joshua” at the Sight and Sound Theatre in Lancaster County on May 29. Front-center seats allow patrons to experience one of the most redemptive and exciting stories of the Bible as Joshua and his followers travel to the Holy Land. Dinner afterward at the Bird in Hand Smorgasbord is included in the price of $195. Trip is open to the public. Contact David at 570-892-1619 or Eileen at 570-328-3359. Taylor Hero banner replacement: Taylor borough is in the process of replacing heroes banners […]

shorts.title: LOCAL COLLEGES: Macciocco gives Marywood men last-second victory
shorts.title_distilled: LOCAL COLLEGES: Macciocco gives Marywood men last-second victory.
shorts.description: Old Forge graduate Joe Macciocco was fouled on a 3-point shot attempt with one second left and sank all three free throws to give the Marywood University men’s basketball team a 73-70 victory at Immaculata University on Thursday in Atlantic East Conference action. Marywood led by as many as 21 points early in the second half and had a 16-point lead with 8½ minutes left when Immaculata scored 11 straight points to spark a 19-3 run that tied the game at 70 with 56 seconds left. Marywood missed a 3-point attempt, but a Mighty Macs turnover gave the Pacers a […]
shorts.content: Old Forge graduate Joe Macciocco was fouled on a 3-point shot attempt with one second left and sank all three free throws to give the Marywood University men’s basketball team a 73-70 victory at Immaculata University on Thursday in Atlantic East Conference action. Marywood led by as many as 21 points early in the second half and had a 16-point lead with 8½ minutes left when Immaculata scored 11 straight points to spark a 19-3 run that tied the game at 70 with 56 seconds left. Marywood missed a 3-point attempt, but a Mighty Macs turnover gave the Pacers a […]

shorts.title: BOYS BASKETBALL: Rose, Antoniacci lead No. 2 Riverside past No. 1 Dunmore
shorts.title_distilled: BOYS BASKETBALL: Rose, Antoniacci lead No.
shorts.description: DUNMORE – Brayden Rose and Nico Antoniacci made sure the only celebrating that took place would be on the Riverside sideline and in the team locker room. Driven by an upset loss three weeks ago, Rose and Antoniacci combined for 72 points and powered the second-ranked Vikings to an overwhelming 88-71 win over No. 1 Dunmore on Thursday night in a Lackawanna League boys basketball game. As it did in the first meeting, the matchup between two explosive offenses drew a sold-out crowd to the Dunmore High School gymnasium. The teams put on a show, and ultimately, the one-two combination […]
shorts.content: DUNMORE – Brayden Rose and Nico Antoniacci made sure the only celebrating that took place would be on the Riverside sideline and in the team locker room.
